com.henrikhedberg.util

Class BufferOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • com.henrikhedberg.util.BufferOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class BufferOutputStream
extends java.io.OutputStream
    An OutputStream that contains an internal buffer to enable communication between thread boundaries.

    A producer thread uses the standard OutputStream interface (write(), close()) to buffer bytes.

    A consumer thread sets a handler with the setHandler(Handler) method to write the buffered bytes into an other OutputStream with the writeTo(OutputStream) method.

    Version:
    1.0 (20150503)
    Author:
    Henrik Hedberg <henrik.hedberg@iki.fi>

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  BufferOutputStream.Handler
      A handler that is called when the specified BufferOutputStream has buffered new bytes or has been asked to close itself.

      Constructs a new BufferOutputStream with the given initial internal buffer size.

      • writeTo

        public int writeTo(java.io.OutputStream output)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the bytes from the internal buffer into the given OutputStream. The internal buffer will be empty after the operation.
